28.heading: Sammy, Vincent, 1972- --Exhibitions.
28.title: Comics Brew 2002/2003.
28.author: [No author]

publication info.publisher: Pro Helvetia Liaison Office South Africa

notes: Sponsored and organized by Pro Helvetia Arts Council of Switzerland, Institut Français d'Afrique du Sud, Technikon Witwatersrand and Bitterkomix.

Catalogue accompanying an exhibition held at Spark! Gallery, Johannesburg, 6 November - 17 November 2002, ; Bell-Roberts Gallery, Cape Town, 18 December - 18 January 2003 ; NSA Gallery, Durban, 28 January - 16 February 2003.

An exhibition of work by South African, French, and Swiss comics artists Jean-Philippe Kalonji (Swiss, 1973-), Pascal Rabaté (French, 1961-), Karlien de Villiers (South African, 1975-), Igubu Collective (South African): (Vincent Sammy (1972-), Moray Rhoda (1969-), Daniel Hugo (1974-), Noel van Ster (1971-)), N.D. Mazin (Andy Mason, South African, 1954-), Thomas Ott (Swiss, 1966-), Jean-Philippe Stassen (Belgian, lives in France, 1966-), and Brendon Bell-Roberts, book designer and publisher (South African, 1967-).

77.heading: Sammy the Baker and the M.A.C.
77.title: Animal Crackers
77.author: by Gene Luen Yang.
notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): Collects "Gordon Yamamoto and the King of the Geeks," in which a dim-witted yet charming student learns a life lesson after a tiny alien craft lodges itself in his nostril, and "Loyola Chin and the San Peligran Order," in which a strange dream causes Loyola to ponder whether it is better to be virtuous or smart. Includes a new story, "Sammy the baker and the M.A.C.," in which a young baker finds a new approach to his craft.

79.title: Sammy the Mouse. Book 2
79.author: Zak Sally.
notes: Summary (from amazon.com via OCLC): "The denizens of Zak Sally's twisted Disneyland are back. Follow H.G. Feekes, Puppy Boy, Carl Urbanski, the Fish and Sammy the Mouse as they wander aimlessly, get excited about pie and fall into debilitating depression. Despite appearances to the contrary there's a palpable quickening in the cartoon air. The random course of events begins to cohere and glimmers of a grand plan begin to emerge."

85.heading: "Sammy's Snigs"* (F Minus, Aug. 22, 2006) / by Tony Carillo.
notes: Summary: Sammy stands back to look at the sign over his new sign shop.

86.title: Sammy's Story
86.author: David Kooharian.
notes: In this story told in comic book format, a dying boy realizes that he has the courage to face his greatest challenge.

88.heading: Samnee, Chris.
88.title: Area 10
88.author: writer, Christos N
88.appears_in: Gage ; art, Chris Samnee ; letters, Clem Robins.
notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): A killer known as Henry the Eighth leaves a trail of decapitated corpses. For NYPD detective Adam Kamen, reeling from a personal tragedy and bitter divorce, cracking the "Henry" case offers a chance to get his life back on track, until a freak accident leaves him with a bizarre brain injury. When he recovers, Adam's perceptions of time are altered. He soon becomes convinced that his condition is tied to the "Henry" killings and that the key may lie in the ancient art of trepanation, the macabre ritual practice of drilling holes in the skull to achieve enlightenment.

89.heading: Samnee, Chris.
89.title: The Autobiography of Matt Murdock
89.author: issue #15
89.appears_in: 1: writers, Mark Waid, Marc Guggenheim & Chris Samnee ; artists Chris Samme & Peter Krause ; colorist, Matthew Wilson ; issues #16-18: storytellers, Mark Waid & Chris Samnee ; colorist, Matthew Wilson ; letterer VC's Joe Caramagna.
notes: "Contains material originally published in magazine form as Daredevil #15.1 and #16-18."

Summary (from amazon.com via OCLC): "In order to preserve the new life he's built, Daredevil is faced with a critical decision which may mean the death of Matt Murdock! Plus, with a new rival in town, is DD's time in San Francisco coming to an end?"

90.heading: Samnee, Chris.
90.title: Checkmate : Fall of the Wall
90.author: writers, Greg Rucka, Eric S
90.appears_in: Trautmann ; pencillers, Joe Bennett, Joe Prado, Chris Samnee ; inkers, Jack Jadson, et al. ; colorist, Santiago Arcas ; letterer, Travis Lanham ; original series covers, Karl Kerschl, Kalman Andrasofszky.
notes: Originally issued in single magazine form as Checkmate, 16-22.

Summary (from SkyRiver): The espionage and intrigue continue as Amanda "The Wall" Waller, Checkmate's White Queen, resorts to blackmail to protect her own covert op interests. Now the rest of Checkmate's "Royal Family" is hot on her trail.

91.heading: Samnee, Chris.
91.title: The Daredevil You Know
91.author: storytellers, Mark Waid & Chris Samnee ; colorist, Matthew Wilson ; letterer, VC's Joe Caramagna.
notes: "Contains material originally published in magazine form as Daredevil #11-15."

Summary (from amazon.com via OCLC): "Daredevil's recent traumas have left him coping in an unexpected way! A mystery that's been building since issue one starts to pay off big! San Francisco now has TWO men without fear, and only one will be left standing!"

147.heading: Sampayo, Carlos, 1943- --Interviews.
147.title: "Récits Croisés"
147.author: José Muñoz, Carlos Sampayo ; propos recueillis à Angoulême en janvier 1996 par Dominique Hérody ; traduits et adaptés avec la complicité de Mercédès Gonzalez et Jean-Pierre Mercier
147.appears_in: p. 30-37 in 9e Art : les Cahiers du Musée de la Bande Dessinée, no. 3 (Jan. 1998).
notes: English summary (from p. 138): "Crossed Paths. In a double interview, Muñoz and Sampayo evoke the following subjects: their childhood in Argentina, the circumstances of their exile in Europe, meeting each other, working together, the aesthetics of black and white, the importance of the passage of time in their scripts, their attitude to New York and to music, and finally, the status of comics."

168.heading: Sampere, Daniel, 1985-
168.title: The Alchemist : a Graphic Novel
168.author: written by Paulo Coelho ; adapted by Derek Ruiz ; artwork by Daniel Sampere and others.
notes: Summary (from dust jacket): Andalusian shepherd boy Santiago travels from his homeland in Spain to the Egyptian desert in search of a treasure buried in the Pyramids. Along the way he meets a Gypsy woman, a man who calls himself king, and an alchemist, all of whom point Santiago in the direction of his quest. No one knows what the treasure is, or if Santiago will be able to surmount the obstacles along the way. But what starts out as a journey to find worldly goods turns into a discovery of the treasure found within.

169.heading: Sampere, Daniel, 1985-
169.title: Death of the Family
169.author: Gail Simone, Ray Fawkes, Scott Snyder, writers ; Daniel Sampere and 10 others, artists ; Ulises Arreola, Blond, FCO Plascencia, Nathan Eyring, Kyle Ritter, colorists ; Dave Sharpe, Dezi Sienty, Richard Starkings, Comicraft's Jimmy Betancourt, Taylor Esposito, letterers.
notes: "Originally published in single magazine form as Batgirl 14-19, Batgirl Annual 1, Batman 17, Young Romance 1."

Summary (from SkyRiver): Batgirl Barbara Gordon must deal with the Joker, the crazed criminal responsible for putting her in a wheelchair, and then must tangle with family demons as her psychotic brother James Jr. comes after her.

170.heading: Sampere, Daniel, 1985-
170.title: The Kids from N.O.W.H.E.R.E.
170.author: Howard Mackie, writer ; Ian Churchill, Norm Rapmund, Daniel Sampere, Jon Sibal, [and 9 others], artists.
notes: "Originally published in single magazine form in The Ravagers 1-7."

Summary (from SkyRiver): A new series spinning directly out of "The Culling" crossover. Fairchild, brother and sister Thunder and Lightning, the monstrous Ridge, Beast Boy, and Terra are being pursued by Rose Wilson and Warblade, who want them dead at any cost. But even as they run from their enemies, these strangers turned allies have to contend with each other as well.

289.title: Sampson and Hercules
289.author: by Bill Newton
289.appears_in: 8 p. in Panhandle Pete and Jennifer, no. 1 (July 1951).
notes: Summary: Panhandle Pete gives Sampson the mouse a mouse-shaped balloon. Sampson inflates the balloon to intimidate the cat, but then the balloon springs a leak. Sampson's brother Herk (who seems to speak a foreign language) then punches the cat right out of the county.
